org.resthub.identity.service.acl

Interface AclService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    TracableService
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AclServiceImpl

    @Transactional(readOnly=false)
public interface AclService
extends TracableService
    Service that manage ACLs. An ACL (Access Control Layer) is the combination of a domain object, a permission and a user's id. TODO

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  AclService.AclServiceChange
      Kind of changes notified by this service

    • Method Detail

      • saveAcl

        void saveAcl(Object domainObject,
           Serializable domainObjectId,
           String userId,
           String permission)
        Saves an ACL (or update the existing one) for a specified owner on a specified resource.
        Parameters:
        domainObject - The resource concerned.
        domainObjectId - The concerned resource Id.
        userId - Id of the user.
        permission - Permission added to this owner on this resource.

      • removeAcl

        void removeAcl(Object domainObject,
             Serializable domainObjectId,
             String userId,
             String permission)
        Removes an ACL for a specified owner on a specified resource.
        Parameters:
        domainObject - The resource concerned.
        domainObjectId - The concerned resource Id.
        userId - Id of the user.
        permission - Permission removed from this owner on this resource.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.security.acls.model.NotFoundException - If the permission is not associated to this owner on

      • getAcls

        @Transactional(readOnly=true)
org.springframework.security.acls.model.Acl getAcls(Object domainObject,
                                                                Serializable domainObjectId)
        Retrieves existing ACL for a specified resource.
        Parameters:
        domainObject - The resource concerned.
        domainObjectId - The concerned resource Id.
        Returns:
        ACL for this resource, containing all permissions of all related owner.

      • saveAcls

        void saveAcls(Object domainObject,
            Serializable domainObjectId,
            String userId,
            List<String> permissions)
        Saves an ACL (or update the existing one) for a specified owner on a specified resource.
        Parameters:
        domainObject - The resource concerned.
        domainObjectId - The concerned resource Id.
        userId - Id of the user.
        permissions - List of permissions added to this owner on this resource.

      • removeAcls

        void removeAcls(Object domainObject,
              Serializable domainObjectId,
              String userId,
              List<String> permissions)
        Removes an ACL for a specified owner on a specified resource.
        Parameters:
        domainObject - The resource concerned.
        domainObjectId - The concerned resource Id.
        userId - Id of the user.
        permissions - List of permissions removed from this owner on this resource.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.security.acls.model.NotFoundException - If the permission is not associated to this owner on

      • addPermission

        void addPermission(Object domainObject,
                 org.springframework.security.acls.model.Sid recipient,
                 String permissionName)
        Add the specified entry from the database
        Parameters:
        domainObject - object to locate an Acl
        recipient - the security identities for which Acl information is required
        permissionName - Permission Name removed from this owner on this resource.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.security.acls.model.NotFoundException - If the permission is not associated

      • addPermission

        void addPermission(Object domainObject,
                 org.springframework.security.acls.model.Sid recipient,
                 int mask)
        Add the specified entry from the database
        Parameters:
        domainObject -
        recipient - the security identities for which Acl information is required
        mask - a permission mask, it's a integer value
        Throws:
        org.springframework.security.acls.model.NotFoundException - If the permission is not associated

      • addPermission

        void addPermission(Object domainObject,
                 org.springframework.security.acls.model.Sid recipient,
                 org.springframework.security.acls.model.Permission permission)
        Add the specified entry from the database
        Parameters:
        domainObject - object to locate an Acl
        recipient - the security identities for which Acl information is required
        permission - a given permission
        Throws:
        org.springframework.security.acls.model.NotFoundException - If the permission is not associated

      • deletePermission

        void deletePermission(Object domainObject,
                    org.springframework.security.acls.model.Sid recipient,
                    org.springframework.security.acls.model.Permission permission)
        Removes the specified entry of permission on given object from Acl object in the database
        Parameters:
        domainObject - object to locate an Acl
        recipient - the security identities for which Acl information is required (may be null to denote all entries)
        permission - a given permission

      • deletePermission

        void deletePermission(Object domainObject,
                    org.springframework.security.acls.model.Sid recipient,
                    String permissionName)
        Removes the specified entry of permission on given object
        Parameters:
        domainObject - object to locate an Acl for
        recipient - the security identities for which Acl information is required
        permissionName - a given permission. The effective permission must be build using ConfigurablePermissionFactory class
